@gregthomas22 @AmielHandelsman It signifies things, but it doesn’t tell me very much about any individual I’m encountering. That’s what I meant.

@Theo_TJ_Jordan Seriously.
@Theo_TJ_Jordan I agree. And Messi is magic. https://t.co/ifrRBOORiC
@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 I do! I don’t think “Italian American” tells me basically anything.
@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 Well I no longer have a forum, but I’ll think about what we can do! @gregthomas22 let’s discuss!
@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 I’d love to chat further about this, for sure! Maybe a round table of some kind with Greg and others.

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 And if that’s the case, I prefer to avoid the racialized language entirely and just go with “American from Chicago” or “Midwesterner” or “Southerner” or whatever, then specify further until you get to an individual again.

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 So in my view “New York Italian” or even “Bronx Italian” is the way to go to specify further. Then you’d go into specific neighborhoods and what not until you just get to an individual. “Black American” and “American” strike me as similarly—if not equally—broad.

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 I definitely recognize the problem, but again I kind of default to Sheena’s position, that “American” is enough. Of course that’s a broad category, but so is Italian American—because people under that label in New Jersey and even New York are markedly different.
@ZaidJilani 🤣🤣🤣
RT @ZaidJilani: I have not read anything Matt Taibbi or Bari Weiss have reported but I'm here to tell you they are completely wrong and/or…
@MsMelChen Looking fresh, Gibbs!

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 Yeah, my main point of contention is with the racialized language, because my project is disabusing people of the concept of race and it’s hard enough without simultaneously trying to reappropriate the terms.
@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 Yes, I agree.
@IsaacKaufman6 She says she recognizes the name but isn’t sure she knows him.

@Carious1 My experience has been that finals and World Series and super bowls have been fun to watch because the stakes are high, but I was never interested in regular season games. We’ll see how it goes with regular season soccer.

There’s a STRAW MAN
Wai…

RT @Meighon: HUGE NEWS! The UnRedacted (Jihad Rehab) has an Offical Trailer! 
Now Playing Dec 9-15 at the Laemmle Monica Film Center (Santa…
@sbkaufman Oh no! I’m glad you’re ok, Scott.

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Yeah, the mischaracterizations continue, but at least I’m not helping them along by crawling into the chalk outline they’ve drawn for me. I also don’t go by “apolitical” or “tribeless” either, for the same reasons. I try to get people to drill down to specifics sooner.
@Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I get it all the time too.
@Cole_August @ArthurCDent @sbkaufman That was just a hypothesis. I have no idea what the reality is.

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Your mileage may vary. I’ve learned after many years of trial and error that there is scarcely a label (specifically one that puts me in some ideological group) that doesn’t burden me with disabusing people of a host of mistaken assumptions as a result. I just gave up eventually.

@Cole_August @ArthurCDent @sbkaufman I have no idea why Lex blocked Arthur. Not sure why I’m being tasked with rationalizing it, as I’ve never said anything to indicate that I know Lex’s mind or can vouch for all of his thoughts and behavior.
@scttfrnks @and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Yeah, that’s also a problem.

@S___Elliott @and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I try not to be a douche, for sure, but people get frustrated at what they view as an unwillingness to take strong positions on things. I have plenty of very strong positions, but I work hard to couch my statements in a recognition of my own ignorance, and alternate perspectives.
@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Yeah, that’s how I meant it.
@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Yeah, it’s a problem.

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I don’t identify myself as left or right wing either, but it’s not because I think it makes me less biased. It’s because I dislike the assumptions and implications people bring to them. I simply try my best to avoid the pratfalls; I don’t claim to have successfully done so. https://t.co/zMWl0pvxa3

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I regularly upset and annoy people for taking that tack, and am often accused of fence-sitting or waffling or whatever as a result, but I’m just trying my best to make sense and be honest and check myself. I fail all the time, but it’s the aspiration.
@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman Basically, I try to embody this: https://t.co/tefvQak7oh

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I try to apply it across the board, but an example would be hearing a speech from Ibram Kendi and resisting the urge to ignore the whole of it because I generally disagree with his perspective. There may be solid points or insights there that I’d miss if I behaved that way.

@ETVPod @and_furiouser @sbkaufman For the record, I trust and defer to experts and absolutely take someone’s history of honesty/dishonesty or reliability/unreliability into account. But I also recognize that this can be a bias and that even broken clocks can be right twice a day, so I tread as carefully as I can.

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 Thanks for the input, Amiel! I totally get what you're saying. Of course the issue is that the remnants of racialization are right there, and I suspect it's too thin of a hair to split at this moment in time. It's tricky, but I still prefer @SheenaMasonPhD's solution: American.

RT @braverangels: Is it moral to engage with people whose perspectives you don't just disagree with, but believe are *dangerous*?

It's a q…

@KralcTrebor @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yes, really. I never said the speaker doesn’t matter, but the veracity of their argument has nothing to do with who they are or what they’ve done or said in the past. They’re either right or wrong, right now.
@manunderbridge @jessesingal 100%
@KralcTrebor @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I don’t mean to claim they are the same.
RT @coldxman: I'm honored to receive the Omni American Young Leaders Award! Thanking everyone who's been a part of this journey, your suppo…

RT @JohnRWoodJr: But, in the end, it is a victory of the human heart over the vicious ignorance of our prejudice and fear.

Love is greater…

Always a pleasure to have chatted with the fabulous @gregthomas22.

In what I believe is my final conversation for #FAIRperspectives, we discuss race, identity, jazz, and an #OmniAmerican future.

Tune in today at 4:00 ET! https://t.co/VMcMtnG9G9
RT @StrangelEdweird: I really enjoyed chatting with @psychosort for his podcast about #starmanning, #freespeech, @elonmusk and @twitter as…
RT @and_furiouser: May your mental breakdowns be uninteresting and non-exploitable 🙏

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, I agree that there’s lots I could agree with, and I have agreed with it! For example, I think Kendi’s definition of racism, from his book, is spot on. As @ErikN_NJEdition said, my disagreements with him are mostly in his prescriptions and the reasoning therein.

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I’m not claiming to be Dr. Manhattan, I’m speaking to an ideal that I try my best to embody. I have defended and agreed with Kendi and DiAngelo, but I tend to disagree with them more overall. You can call that tribal bias, or the result of engaging with the merits of their ideas. https://t.co/f7ZC4RJ5Px

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Well, I have the ideal and the fundamental value of not allowing myself to be tribal and inconsistent in that way, and that’s what I strive toward. I will fail and have failed often; I’m only human, but that’s my goal and I think it’s a worthy one.

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod The *merits* of each idea are absolutely independent from the man, his goals, and his biases. It’s either true or not; it either makes sense or it doesn’t. Whether the source is a piece of shit is irrelevant to that. That’s the only point I’ve been trying to make.

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I stopped listening to Bret when he stopped producing content of interest to me. I’m not just listening to everything and everyone without discernment. But I’m open to assessing something he says on its merits right now if I hear it. I have no stake in him being right or wrong.
@Sandwich_Smith Plucky, wisecracking kids that we’re supposed to identify with or find endearing but actually just annoy everybody and make the protagonist’s job harder.
@ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, that sounds about right to me.

@ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod And I think what may be important to point out here is that someone’s character/reputation may affect my judgment, but all I’m really in it for is the idea. I am not a “fan” of people in that way. I don’t have “gurus,” so I have no personal stake in whether they’re right or not.

@ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yes, I think there’s a fair amount of talking past each other here as we try to parse this.

An idea is presented. I assess it on its merits. The fact that the presenter of the idea has shown poor judgment or dishonesty is something I note, but ultimately I just assess the idea.

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, I never said otherwise. But I still do think the merits of the idea itself take precedent over whatever judgments I have of the source.

@CarlosCMTF @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It has gradually become the norm throughout history—that’s what modern civilization is. There is still war and violence, but far less than there was in the past, and the trend keeps going in that direction.

@CarlosCMTF @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I’d prefer someone sincerely orient their behavior towards doing good in the world and be called naive or self-important for it (however true that may be about them), than not. Of course I don’t think Lex will stop the war; all I’ve been saying is I appreciate where his heart is.
@Egypxican @CarlosCMTF @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Always try.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod No, I don’t. I just acknowledge that despite the past, Bret may not be wrong in this case, and it’s important for me not to allow his past to totally bias my assessment. If what he’s saying makes sense, I have no problem accepting that.

@ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, I agree with this. I never said the source doesn’t matter, only that it doesn’t matter as much as the merits of the statement itself.
@shutter_j I've already got #1, and I have watched enough movies to know #3 is nothing but trouble, so this question is actually really easy.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod At the end of the day, my thing is: Does this idea make sense or not? The answer to that isn't and shouldn't be affected by the source of the idea in question.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod To clarify, I agree that the source matters to a point—and that if the source has a history of being unreliable for one reason or another, that factors into my assessment of the idea. But that in itself is also a bias that needs checking, because even a broken clock and all that.
@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, if someone has a history of dishonesty, I'd definitely note that going forward.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, of course one should consider the biases involved, but to me that's part of the process of assessing a given idea, not a separate thing. I also tend to reset that process for every idea. So if Bret forwards 100 stupid arguments in a row, I'd still hear 101 on its merits.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Well yeah, he was clearly lying and that was discovered, so I would recognize the lies for what they are/were. But as you mentioned, they wouldn't affect my perception of effective altruism, for example, because the merits of EA are independent of SBF's allegiance to them.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I'm sure his worldview informs his approach and his conclusions, as is the case with us all. But that's irrelevant to whether any ideas he forwards are good, interesting, or useful. It's been a while and it's late, so nothing specific comes to mind, unfortunately.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I get what you're saying, but I just don't really think of public figures in that way. Because of how I approach things, what you're asking me is akin to asking whether learning of Bill Cosby's crimes as an adult changed whether I enjoyed his comedy growing up.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod My earlier appraisals were never of him, only the ideas he discussed and the stuff I learned from him. I got a lot out of that stuff, and I didn't retroactively not get a lot out of it once he started saying stuff I thought was ridiculous or insane.

@Cole_August @C_Kavanagh @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod But of course that's just coming from my vantage point. There may be something about having 100k+ followers that would change that for me.

tweets.text: @StrangelEdweird My wife was up until 4am watching Argentina today - Chinese can be hard core.
Ghost World 🥰 https://t.co/dnibDd50Rs

@StrangelEdweird @AmielHandelsman Thanks, Amiel, for engaging on this topic with Angel! I'll only say a few things, as this is to complex and nuanced, ultimately, for this forum. Italian American does signify something to me. And it does to Italians whose ancestry extends from Italy. Traditions, styles, etc.
@StrangelEdweird I agree with Wood that we have to deal with bias and human nature. But it is frustrating that we need to understand someone’s delusion when the facts speak for themselves.

@CathyYoung63 @MsMelChen Like, I guarantee you @HistoryBoomer and @StrangelEdweird both have their feeds set to "latest" as opposed to "home." The only people who regularly saw my tweets were people who opted out of the algorithm.
@StrangelEdweird He's never been my guy, but I'd love to see him bring home this World Cup trophy. International success has been the only hole in his resume.
@StrangelEdweird HO-LY SHIT! 🔥🔥🔥🔥⚽️

urls.title: Is White People Playing Jazz Cultural Appropriation? w/ Greg Thomas
urls.description: #jazz #beingprohuman #fairperspectives #angeleduardo #melissachen #racism #eminem #prince #music Our guest this week is Greg Thomas. Greg is a writer, teache...

tweets.text:
"What prevented me from going down the rabbit hole of hate was the music. It was my love for jazz and immersing myself in jazz in high school. I didn't segregate who I listened to and liked based on 'race.'" 
 
🎙️ #FAIRperspectives with @gregthomas22: https://t.co/gLMQevHnUE https://t.co/cCa61cFGIs

@StrangelEdweird Quite a good adjective for that man! One of a kind, for sure.

Boy, NED has sure turned this game interesting at the end though, eh? 🧐

@StrangelEdweird The World Cup is such an amazing event! The energy that comes behind every team into those stadiums is spectacular. Like the souls of nations traveling abroad. Then the low-scoring nature of soccer builds that tension up to a level I'm not sure we get anywhere else in sports.
@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 ...apply the same principles to cultural groups? :)
@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 I'd love to do that live. As they say, name the place, and I'll be there.

@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 ...about each of these concerns seems useful. As I say, it's hard enough to understand one another when we're having the same conversation—much harder when we are in separate conversations!

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 So in my view “New York Italian” or even “Bronx Italian” is the way to go to specify further. Then you’d go into specific neighborhoods and what not until you just get to an individual. “Black American” and “American” strike me as similarly—if not equally—broad.

@AmielHandelsman @gregthomas22 I definitely recognize the problem, but again I kind of default to Sheena’s position, that “American” is enough. Of course that’s a broad category, but so is Italian American—because people under that label in New Jersey and even New York are markedly different.

@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 Angel, I totally hear you. That's the pickle with "Black American." No matter how many times you say it's a cultural distinction, people hear "Black" and think racial. I'm still using it because it beats the alternatives for me. But I see the downside.
I have not read anything Matt Taibbi or Bari Weiss have reported but I'm here to tell you they are completely wrong and/or probably listen to Nickelback.

Ok, groomer.

You did a pretty good job. https://t.co/RxlFrxGnh4

@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 ...as for "too thin of a hair to split," I'm suggesting that this is precisely the hair to split in order to distinguish culture from ancestry. Indeed, if you don't like the term "Black Americans," then my example supports using the term with fewer people.

@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 Hi Angel, thanks for the reply. Perhaps I should rephrase my question: if in an alternative universe you agreed with Greg's both/and idea (and the value of naming Black Americans), then does the person I've described count as Black American. I say no.
@StrangelEdweird How does your wife feel about Edgar Renteria? (Only Colombian baseball player I can think of.)
@StrangelEdweird Personally futball is boring unless it is the World Cup.

This is the moment Mars peeked out from behind our moon after being hidden for an hour. This shot was captured using my largest telescope and a special high-speed camera. Seeing another planet rising on the horizon of our moon was such a surreal experience. https://t.co/8IctbVXuUM
@StrangelEdweird I love your wife

Well, we’re not talking about relativism.

In the context of our work, it’s more that you can’t communicate and connect with someone unless you understand how they interpret the world. 

The facts of the world alone are not enough. Yet mere *facts* is where so many want to focus. https://t.co/5l0Risx3j4
https://t.co/AI6o8MrHIv
Amazing how The Twitter Files confirm everything everybody already thought, no matter what it is they already thought.

There's a STRAW MAN
Waiting in the dirt
He’s gonna ruin discourse
Doesn’t matter who it hurts

There’s a STRAW MAN
Waiting in the dirt
Derailing conversation
So our good faith doesn’t work

He told me
Let the children push it
Let the children bullshit
Let all the children blow it

Friday Dec. 9 A group of men trained by al-Qaeda are transferred from Guantanamo and sent to the world’s first rehabilitation center for “terrorists,” located in Saudi Arabia. Documentary, Politics & World Affairs, Justice Nominee, Grand Jury Prize ~ Documentary, Sundance Film Festival Empathy can an inherent part of the documentary form, but it seems to have been a speciality

@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman I'm not trying to say your choice is wrong. If you go by "apolitical" or "tribeless" or whatever, maybe that suits you best. I'm just saying, I'm not buying it's a sensible reaction to giving up. If it's more accurate, it's more accurate for the normal reasons.

@and_furiouser @StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman Not sure either.  He does probably get a lot of people calling him RW and probably some who call him LW "in disguise" (this is something I see pretty often from RW people).  I could see wanting to clarify.
@StrangelEdweird @ArthurCDent @sbkaufman Maybe asked that the wrong way, was stringing it back to previous thread with assumption of limited bandwidth and follower count.

@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman But it's not as well defined as something scientific for sure. (I guess we coudl also make a scientific concept, but then we have to accept we'll deny people's identities and start calling apolitical people conservatives based on their actions).
@ArthurCDent @StrangelEdweird @sbkaufman @StrangelEdweird I'd challenge you to try and rationalize his blocking of @ArthurCDent as a means to clear up his comments section.

@and_furiouser @StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman In general, I agree with Angel’s inclination to defer to experts. But the term has become a tool for advancing narratives. Can’t count how many headlines include “experts say”. And often in instances of opinion where no “expertise” could provide anything close to objective truth.
@StrangelEdweird @and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I don't think you annoy and upset too many people. You're a particularly likable person.

@ETVPod @StrangelEdweird @sbkaufman Then I think that's a situation where it would make sense as well defined recommendation for how to appraoch the topic better.

I read "literally" as modifying "impossible", not "taking ideas one by one and not seeing them through a political lens"
@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman each thing he says is so manifestly stupid, but I guess I see the danger in some people being drawn to him.
"A label is an intellectually lazy way to assert you know more about a person than you actually do, and therefore don't have to engage them in a conversation." -@neiltyson

@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman The part of this I dislike is Lex saying he isn't left or right wing. That seems like an irrelevant detail. I don't think having no overall political affiliation makes you better at accomplishing this. We can all do our best to be open minded, but we don't have to be centrist.
@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman Me too, but in truth, it hasn't helped me socially.

"If a bigot says to me, 'The sun is shining,' if the sun is shining, I say, 'Yes the sun is shining,' because I want to tell the truth."

-Bayard Rustin

@and_furiouser @ETVPod @sbkaufman I try to apply it across the board, but an example would be hearing a speech from Ibram Kendi and resisting the urge to ignore the whole of it because I generally disagree with his perspective. There may be solid points or insights there that I’d miss if I behaved that way.
@StrangelEdweird @ETVPod @sbkaufman Did you have any examples of topics where you're taking this tread-carefully technique?
@and_furiouser @StrangelEdweird @sbkaufman It’s still gonna mean trusting experts. Even the most hard core cult member is gonna have to trust someone else after. There’s no epistemology in isolation.

@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 p.s. Therefore, when any of us refer to black-identified Americans as Black Americans without knowing the extent to which they live in the culture, we are making a very understandable slip. Odds of us being accurate might be 70% or 90% but not 100%
@DaveMacLachlan1 White Room - cream
The belief that one is aggrieved may be one of the best predictors of an unfulfilled life. It seems like this belief is encouraged by many.
@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 This makes me feel really sad. I’ve enjoyed co-piloting this thing with you. I really hope it’s not the end of us working together
I really resonate with this. This is what I try to do on my podcast as well. I simply don't view everything through a political lens but take ideas one by one. https://t.co/yfLu66mXzk
@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 I've greatly enjoyed these podcasts. Do you know if Melissa is going to continue doing them?

tweets.text:
What does #BeProHuman mean to @gregthomas22?

Hint: Rooted cosmopolitanism.

Check out #FAIRperspectives Ep. 35 - Jazz vs. Racism 👉 https://t.co/T9CLu6N2Kh https://t.co/w9t25DyLDx
@HistoryBoomer You should be happy you refrained. As a result, I will grant clemency and let you live.
Thrilled to be a 2022 Shortlist Selection for the #NonObviousBookAwards! Top 15 nonfiction pic of the year! @Non_Obvious @BenBellaBooks https://t.co/M444utQnQ5
@StrangelEdweird @gregthomas22 Greg would be a tailor made guest for @choralosophy . This was a GREAT chat

Wonderful and thought provoking conversation between @gregthomas22 and @StrangelEdweird. 

Love the teasing out of how we seek to 'play' and the nuance regarding cultural appropriation. https://t.co/gJeJuUYEqn
@HistoryBoomer If you're not seeing punishment, you lack imagination. I would punish you VERY VERY thoroughly.
Life is a miracle. We are accidents. https://t.co/f6Vbhc1hqz
People need to be reminded of what miracles they are.
@PurePopPub Minimal effort seduction might be better!

I'm a free speech absolutist, that means if someone tells me they go to an Indian restaurant and order things "mild," I may hold their speech in contempt, but it's their right as Americans to be that weak.

Is it moral to engage with people whose perspectives you don't just disagree with, but believe are *dangerous*?

It's a question we often get in the work we do, so @moniguzman asked moral psychologist @JonHaidt. Here's what he said. 👇 https://t.co/T3rxMHdnN3

@jessesingal I find the mental illness/bigotry debate obviated by the fact that no one chooses their mind, their genetics, or their environmental influences. Both a mentally ill bigot and a "sane" bigot are equally deserving of compassion. They got shafted in the brain lottery.

@StrangelEdweird @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It's not just about negging people either.

If someone who is super sharp and thoughtful says something I think is blatantly wrong, I'm led to wonder differently than if my idiot cousin says the same thing. They aren't the same.
I'm honored to receive the Omni American Young Leaders Award! Thanking everyone who's been a part of this journey, your support means the world to me. https://t.co/mABJsaF9BP

But, in the end, it is a victory of the human heart over the vicious ignorance of our prejudice and fear.

Love is greater than its opposites. Love overcomes. https://t.co/ZzxEdFfG55

Today at 4 pm ET, I'll be a guest on the @fairforall_org podcast with @StrangelEdweird.  #fairperspectives
https://t.co/GuNG6SAr9W

urls.title: Angel Eduardo: Starmanning, Free Speech, and the End of Polarization
urls.description: Listen now (3 hr) | Angel on Twitter Moderation: https://quillette.com/2022/11/23/twitter-is-not-the-town-square/ Angel Eduardo and Curtis Yarvin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fkLhtTT1vnQ Geoff Shullenberger on Popularism: https://compactmag.com/article/the-death-of-popularism

tweets.text:
I really enjoyed chatting with @psychosort for his podcast about #starmanning, #freespeech, @elonmusk and @twitter as a “public square,” optimism about society and the future, and much more! 

Check it here: https://t.co/6fjyyVvNK9 https://t.co/4LbtGG5b4V
May your mental breakdowns be uninteresting and non-exploitable 🙏

@StrangelEdweird @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yes sure that is entirely reasonable to me given that you mostly disagree with their views. If you were treating each of their statements in isolation though and not thinking about that you’d have lots you could agree with and whether you agree them overall is irrelevant.

@C_Kavanagh @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Well, I have the ideal and the fundamental value of not allowing myself to be tribal and inconsistent in that way, and that’s what I strive toward. I will fail and have failed often; I’m only human, but that’s my goal and I think it’s a worthy one.

@ErikN_NJEdition @StrangelEdweird @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod … dispassionately approach all claims and evaluate them purely on their evidential merits but if you think you do that with no biases you are delusional. As an aspirational goal 👍 as something that is put into practice consistently. Show me your threads praising Kendi’s ideas.

@StrangelEdweird @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It isn’t about having a stake one way or the other but being realistic about your ability to distribute charity absolutely equally to all. I don’t think that’s plausible and I’ve never seen someone in the heterodox sphere practice it consistently with outgroup folk.

@StrangelEdweird @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Hitler will have said many true things in his life. That does not mean we should approach Hitler’s writings as if each idea is independent from the man, his goals, and his biases. To do so would not make someone rational but unduly credulous. The same applies to everyone else.

@StrangelEdweird @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Right, so you say but I’d be very curious to see that in practice. Like I get it as a guiding creed but in reality you would be constantly evaluating who you trust/heed/consider worth your time and that would be coloring your assessment of ideas.

Which kind of character in fiction do you absolutely loathe to point of wishing they weren't in the story?

I don't mean a vile villain (you're supposed to hate those). I mean secondary ones who almost ruin the narrative.

My ex: weak-willed characters

@StrangelEdweird @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Right.  I think Chris is concerned that you're saying that the speaker doesn't affect your process at all once you get to evaluating the merits, whereas you (and I) are concerned that Chris is trying (not necessarily intentionally) to sneak in a speaker effect on the merits.

@ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yes, I think there’s a fair amount of talking past each other here as we try to parse this.

An idea is presented. I assess it on its merits. The fact that the presenter of the idea has shown poor judgment or dishonesty is something I note, but ultimately I just assess the idea.

@StrangelEdweird @Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod The "as much" makes me nervous because it makes it sound like they're being weighed on the same scale.  To me, these are two different axes that don't interact at all: the merits of the statement axis and the scrutiny called for axis.

@StrangelEdweird @ErikN_NJEdition @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yup! So in my hypothetical I guess you’d start of more skeptical of Bret’s claims, given he is often wrong about scientific issues. But he could be right and if he was that’s be fine. In the Sam way Alex Jones could be right but it wouldn’t make his method any more valid.

@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I hate to be negative and a "doomer" in this aspect but just look st History.
If conversations/debates were really effective wouldn't it gradually become
the norm throughout history? 

Instead there's only one thing that is consistently in solving anything: War.

@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Even is this situation could be magically defused by having a conversation it's certainly not Lex Fridman they would pick to have it.

This is a common problem of podcasters in general - the pretentiousness of assuming that debates can solve any problems and uncover any truths.

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I’m trying something right now with a film - it’s out there for this polarized time. I’m scared I’ll do a bad job, I’m scared it won’t be worth it, im scared I’ll enable bad forces, but what we’re doing isn’t working and we have to try something else. Should I not try?

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod So you meet Bret the anti-vaxxer with a history of misunderstanding studies and claiming conspiracies and you meet Stuart an experienced scientist with a long track record of research and advocacy for science reform. You treat any new claim made by both as equally likely?

@Egypxican @C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I think the speaker has absolutely no bearing on the truth of the statement, but I think (for more complicated statements that depend on third-person evidence) I'm going to use more scrutiny with people who have a history of lying/manipulating/sloppy work.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod To clarify, I agree that the source matters to a point—and that if the source has a history of being unreliable for one reason or another, that factors into my assessment of the idea. But that in itself is also a bias that needs checking, because even a broken clock and all that.

@C_Kavanagh @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, of course one should consider the biases involved, but to me that's part of the process of assessing a given idea, not a separate thing. I also tend to reset that process for every idea. So if Bret forwards 100 stupid arguments in a row, I'd still hear 101 on its merits.

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yup, but you might look more sceptically at some talk he gave about what his organisation was specifically doing and what his motivations for promoting EA were. Which would be my point… later information about a source can impact how you assess their earlier material you liked.

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod No worries! Just curious. And yeah where we disagree is that I think there is no barrier between 1) considering ideas and 2) considering the source of the ideas and the biases involved. Some circumstances were you don’t care about 2) but with online pundits usually informative.

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Ah, not really. It would be more like does learning what SBF was doing impact your assessment of the validity of his earlier claims? I’m not talking about effective altruism as a concept but specifically what he claimed about what he valued and was doing. I’d say it should.

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod You don’t think a lot of Bret’s ideas are linked to his broader worldview, approach to science & reasoning, and based on his experiences? Say like his evolutionary theories? He seems to connect quite a lot of them himself. Glad you found stuff of value! Any ideas in particular?

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod …often beneficial if someone notices a surprising shift in some people they admire/value whether any biases might have prevented them from recognising the issues. Especially if others were pointing out the relevant issues before and I’d dismissed them. People change and are…

@StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Did his descent ever make you curious if your earlier appraisals were off or do you just think he dramatically changed and become unreasonable? I don’t mind how people like to draw their social venn diagrams I just think you should recognise a spade as a spade. And that it’s…

@Cole_August @C_Kavanagh @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Yeah, I never block because there doesn't seem to be any utility to it; it doesn't even do the thing you want it to do, because all your tweets are still just another account or a private browser away. Makes no sense to me.
